alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 7:43PM MST until January 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 2 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 to 60 mph. * WHERE...Yellowstone National Park, Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park
